description: 1920s, from Ukrainian глей (hlej, “clayey soil”), from Proto-Slavic *glьjь, from Proto-Indo-European *gl̥h₁y-ó-s, from Proto-Indo-European *gleh₁y-. Cognate of clay.

entries.meaning: (soil science) A type of hydric soil, sticky, greenish-blue-grey in colour and low in oxygen.

verbs.description: gley (third-person singular simple present gleys, present participle gleying, simple past and past participle gleyed)

entries.meaning: (soil science) To be converted into this kind of soil.

verbs.description: gley (third-person singular simple present gleys, present participle gleying, simple past and past participle gleyed)

entries.meaning: (Scotland) To squint; to look obliquely; to overlook things.
